/* Introduction and Background */ This is a paper about the psychology of terrorists, and I can't see any explicit declarations of Hezbollah committing bombings in it.
/* Introduction and Background */ Duplicate reference, and this one also doesn't directly list murder BY Hezbollah, only OF Hezbollah members.
/* Introduction and Background */ This reference lists a kidnapping OF a Hezbollah official, not a kidnapping BY Hezbollah.
/* Introduction and Background */ Cleaning up English in first sentence.
/* Introduction and Background */ incomplete sentence unsourced by the footnotes please do not reinsert that statement unless sources can be found for it and it can be written as a complete sentence
/* Stance on what is a legitimate military target */ The article cited does not say "women and children", it says "targets". Also, fixed a minor grammar problem.
/*I moved {{Groups supported by Islamic Republic of Iran}} to the correct place*/
/* Other links - I moved a link to [[Hezbollah military activities]] */
/* Outside views of Hezbollah */ the source says nothing about a Canadian controversy over the decision. It just talks about Hezbollah's reaction to it.
Moving this box down. It has some alignment problems higher up.
Trying to summarize this paragraph. There are only six nations, so we might as well list them all out, in the two groups, rather than mentioning who doesn't. The more indepth section does that.
/* Introduction and Background */ deleted an incomplete sentence that was unsourced by the footnotes.
/* See also */ {{Groups supported by Islamic Republic of Iran}}
/* Designation as a terrorist organization */ Redundant wiki link
/* Funding */ Removing reference that has been removed.
Matching article text to what the remaining reference states.
/* Outside views of Hezbollah -Forbes (file not found) Globalcomment (Page not found)*/
/* Introduction and Background-Forbes (file not found) and globalcomment (page not found) */
/* Introduction and Background - I removed Jewish virtual library:Object not found! -Error 404*/
stating that the EU does not consider them terrorists is misleading because it emplies all members of the EU. The Netherlands considers them terrorists.
Agree with removal of term "highly political". Changing the rest of the sentence to match the reference already cited in the article.
not all countries and people consider it controversial. the terrorist label is not necessarily primarily political. you need to justify that the label is highly political.
/* Foreign relations */ refs ... see talk page
Adding citation request to correspond to commented out reference.
This reference does not match article text. Please find one which does.
/* Outside views of Hezbollah */ redlink wanted
/* Introduction and Background */ The Lebanese army demarcates the region as within Syrian territory; Just now for political expediancy it changed its public stand.
rv: This has been discussed before.
/* Introduction and Background */ Actually, is this necessary? The previous paragraph goes into much more detail on this subject.
/* Introduction and Background */ The introduction specifically states that it isn't considered a terrorist organization by the EU.
Made known relevant information at the beginning of the introduction.
removed a redundant sentence. If 6 nations consider them terrorists, then there is no need to state that the rest of the nations of this world do not consider them terrorists.

hezbollah at incepton was also against the phalangists, and were very active against them as well as israel
actually, the Israeli invasion of lebanon was onlly one of the forces which led to the developement of hezbollah
/* Position on Jews and Judaism */ spelling correction
It is still a political party
/* Stance on what is a legitimate military target */ if we mention the Battle of Jenin, we might as well mention the Passover massacre. These have nothing to do with Hezbollah.
/* Stance on what is a legitimate military target */
/*Position on use of armed strength to achieve aims*/
Please stop. The group has two parts; 1 military, 1 political. Listing the nations that consider the military == terrorist is fine, but the name itself should not be "terrorist" to begin with.
No, it doesn't make any sense.
/* Designation as a terrorist organization */ differentiating between terror and political meaning the political 1 is not terrorist, saying that they just differentiate does not mean anything

This doesn't make any sense. The countries ban all parts that they think is involved in terrorist activity. Some countries have only desingnated military wing as terrorist
